# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the Julia program that solves this problem:
```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end

# Example usage:
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer id nunc nec orci sollicitudin malesuada."
print(wrap_string(s))
```
This function splits the input string into words and checks if adding a new word to the result would exceed `text_width`. If so, it adds a newline character instead. It also ensures that there is a space between words in the final output. 

The example usage wraps the given text after every `text_width` characters or at the end of each sentence.
